preqs: LAW5000 or LAW5080 or LAW5081, LAW5002 or LAW7265, LAW5006 and LAW5004 (for students beginning in 2015 or later)

rules.ruleString: For COURSE_CODE IN {3387} Do Must have passed 3 units in {LAW5000, LAW5002, LAW5006, LAW5080, LAW7212, LAW7267, LAW7428, LAW7470} Otherwise Must have passed 4 units in {LAW5000, LAW5002, LAW5004, LAW5006, LAW5080}
Must be enrolled in course version {3387, L6005}

description: The unit introduces students to the nature and function of trusts in the modern Australian legal system. Students learn how trusts are used and learn the rules governing their existence. In particular, the rules governing the creation and administration of trusts, and the rights and obligations of parties to trusts.
